entry.id: Go & Grow updates: Simplified returns at 6% p.a. - 2025-03-01T00:00:00Z

entry.content: Starting 1 April 2025, Go & Grow investors will enjoy a streamlined experience with a single return rate of up to 6%* p.a. No more monthly limits or varying rates—just straightforward daily returns. This change follows positive investor feedback after the removal of monthly limits in September 2024.

entry.id: Growth in Mexican loan portfolio - 2025-03-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Growth in Mexican loan portfolio
entry.content: Lonvest shares performance data on its Mexican lending portfolio since July 2024. CliCredito’s CEO reveals the lender has disbursed $2.4 million in loans since launch, with consistent monthly growth. Currently, investors on Lonvest hold a €885,000 stake in these loans. The figures highlight expanding opportunities in Mexico’s credit market.

entry.id: Hoovi to buy back €2M in loans amid bank funding deal - 2025-02-27T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Hoovi to buy back €2M in loans amid bank funding deal
entry.content: Loan originator Hoovi is set to buy back approximately €2 million of its loans from the Income marketplace this week. The move aligns with ongoing talks to secure bank funding, which will lower Hoovi’s capital costs and strengthen its growth. As part of the deal, the bank will invest in Hoovi’s loans, reinforcing confidence in its lending model. Hoovi will continue offering new investment opportunities on Income.

entry.id: EstateGuru struggles with loan recoveries in January - 2025-02-22T00:00:00Z
entry.title: EstateGuru struggles with loan recoveries in January
entry.content: EstateGuru reported that just €400,000 had been recovered from problematic loans in January 2025, highlighting ongoing challenges in reducing defaults. While loans issued in 2023 and 2024 perform reasonably well, the platform still faces over €133 million in recovery efforts.

Investors can earn a fixed annual interest of 11.5%–12%, plus up to 30% in capital gains if the property sells above projections. The project is valued at EUR 11.83M, with an expected profit of EUR 1.69M.

entry.id: LANDE reports record-breaking January 2025 performance - 2025-02-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE reports record-breaking January 2025 performance
entry.content: LANDE achieved another record month, with investors earning €178,270 in interest. The platform also saw a historic high in repaid principal, totaling €1.77M. As part of its risk strategy, LANDE is shifting focus from livestock and harvest-backed loans to land and machinery-backed projects. Most 90+ day delayed loans are now in enforcement, with bailiffs recovering collateral value. The 3% cashback campaign for investments on the primary market continues!

Honey Loan has rapidly built a portfolio exceeding EUR 1 million in just six months. Loan volumes are currently limited, providing exclusive early investment opportunities.

entry.id: Mintos offers loans with up to 17% interest rate - 2025-02-20T00:00:00Z

Notable lenders include Nera Capital (up to 17.0%), Iute Group (up to 13.7%), and Eleving Group (up to 13.6%), providing diverse investment opportunities.

entry.content: Abele Finance will now classify loans based on the borrower's location rather than the loan originator’s country. Currently, all loans on Nectaro will be labeled as Cyprus-based, reflecting the actual end borrowers.

entry.id: Explore new platforms as loan availability tightens on top-rated P2P platforms - 2025-02-03T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Explore new platforms as loan availability tightens on top-rated P2P platforms
entry.content: Due to a decreased availability of loans on top-rated platforms featured on P2P Empire, opportunities to invest may be limited. For those looking to allocate funds in the P2P loan market, we recommend considering alternative platforms such as Fintown, Income Marketplace, Nectaro, Lonvest, or Indemo, which continue to offer viable investment options.

entry.title: Fintown CEO shares key updates in an exclusive interview

These insights provide a clearer picture of Fintown’s future direction. Watch the summary in our exclusive Fintown review.

entry.id: Reinvest24 faces multiple legal battles in Moldova - 2025-02-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Reinvest24 faces multiple legal battles in Moldova
entry.content: Reinvest24 is involved in nine ongoing legal proceedings in Moldova, covering bankruptcy cases, restructuring disputes, mortgage rights, and insolvency claims. Key hearings are set throughout 2025. Additionally, the company has engaged with Moldovan authorities, leading to criminal investigations into corruption. As Moldova progresses toward EU integration, judicial reforms are underway, including the vetting of Judge Valeriu Pedurari, whose rulings have impacted Reinvest24's cases.

entry.id: InRento wins Europe FinTech Award, expands across Europe - 2025-02-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento wins Europe FinTech Award, expands across Europe
entry.content: InRento achieved a major milestone in 2024, winning the Best Investment Technology Platform at the Europe FinTech Awards. The company expanded into Poland and Ireland, introduced innovations like the Secondary Market Grand Sale, and reinforced its position in premium real estate investments. In 2025, InRento will focus on large-scale hotel projects, leveraging the sector’s post-COVID growth and stability to offer high-yield opportunities in strategic markets.

entry.id: Hoovi introduces "Collection Claim" loans backed by real estate - 2025-01-24T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Hoovi introduces "Collection Claim" loans backed by real estate
entry.content: Estonian SME lender Hoovi is launching a new loan category—Collection Claim Loans—featuring loans in recovery with predictable cash flows. Backed primarily by real estate collateral, these loans offer 13.5% p.a. returns, a 60-month maturity, and a 60 DPD buyback guarantee. While Hoovi retains collateral rights, investors benefit from Hoovi’s recovery-driven strategy and junior share logic. Update your auto-invest settings to explore this balanced, higher-return option.

entry.id: Attractive Buy-to-Let Project in Poland - 2025-01-09T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Attractive Buy-to-Let Project in Poland
entry.content:
InRento has launched the Zlota 71 investment project in Kalisz, Poland. This buy-to-let opportunity offers investors a fixed annual return of 11.5–12% and up to 30% in capital gains.
The project includes a five-storey complex with 160 apartments, 6 commercial spaces, and extensive parking. With a competitive 70% loan-to-value (LTV) ratio and a projected sales value of EUR 11.83M, Zlota 71 aims to deliver solid returns in one of Poland’s oldest cities.

entry.id: Income reflects on a year of growth and trust in 2024 - 2025-01-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income reflects on a year of growth and trust in 2024
entry.content:
Income celebrated significant milestones in 2024, with €59.5M loans listed and €57.4M invested. Investor confidence soared, driving a 77% growth in active portfolios, outpacing 2023’s 53%. Loan repayments totaled €50.5M, underscoring strong loan performance.
Newcomers like Ibancar and Sandfield joined, while top loan originators like Danarupiah attracted €27.9M in investments. High-value portfolios surged, with those over €100K growing 166.67%, reflecting deepening trust in Income’s secure, high-yield opportunities.

entry.id: CreditPrime Moldova achieves 50% loan portfolio growth in 2024 - 2024-12-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: CreditPrime Moldova achieves 50% loan portfolio growth in 2024
entry.content:
CreditPrime Moldova, a brand of Ecofinance, grew its loan portfolio by 50% in 2024 to MDL 139.8 million (€7.7 million). The company, Moldova’s first fully online microfinance institution, also diversified its funding sources, with Nectaro as a major partner and local bank contributions increasing fourfold.
Notable advancements included the launch of Instant Payments, enabling 24/7 financing, and strengthened risk management systems aligned with “Responsible Lending” regulations. With 91% of its portfolio classified as “Good Book” loans, CreditPrime is setting new standards in Moldova’s financial sector.

entry.title: New investment deals: Up to 15% APY

entry.title: UnaFinancial exits Sri Lanka
entry.content: UnaFinancial is exiting Sri Lanka due to market changes. Its entity, Rapidlend (PVT), has repaid all loans to RC RIGA. Investors will receive principal and interest by December 23, 2024. With Sri Lankan loans comprising just 0.15% of the portfolio, platform operations remain unaffected.

entry.title: Holiday season update: Limited support and transfer delays ahead

entry.id: Clickcash repayment pause extended - 2024-12-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Clickcash repayment pause extended
entry.content:
ClickCash expects to secure funding by February 2025 to strengthen operations and resume direct repayments.
The pause on bridging repayments, initially set for August–November 2024, is extended through December 2024 and January 2025.
Repayments are targeted to resume in February 2025, depending on ClickCash’s funding status, either through direct payments or bridging by Income.

entry.id: PeerBerry completes repayment of EUR 51.4 Million in war-affected loans - 2024-12-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry completes repayment of EUR 51.4 Million in war-affected loans
entry.content:
PeerBerry, a leading P2P investment platform, has successfully processed the final repayment of loans impacted by the war in Ukraine. Since February 24, 2022, PeerBerry's business partners, Aventus Group and Gofingo Group, have repaid investors a total of EUR 51.4 million, including accrued interest.
This milestone makes PeerBerry the first and only investment platform in the market to fully meet its war-affected obligations, setting a benchmark for investor protection and resilience in times of crisis.

entry.id: Income Marketplace ensures investors security with Sandfield Capital loans - 2024-12-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Income Marketplace ensures investors security with Sandfield Capital loans
entry.content:
Income has introduced Sandfield Capital as a Loan Originator, emphasizing that its financial status does not impact loan security. These litigation-focused bullet loans are fully insured by Accelerant Insurance Europe SA (A- rated), ensuring investor compensation in case of default.
The loans are structured through a bankruptcy-remote SPV (SFC4), isolating risks and maintaining uninterrupted repayments to investors. With law firms carefully vetted and comprehensive insurance in place, Income provides a robust dual-layered protection system, underscoring its commitment to transparency and investor safety.

entry.id: TWINO faces diversification challenges while expanding in Poland - 2024-12-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO faces diversification challenges while expanding in Poland
entry.content:
TWINO's investment portfolio is heavily concentrated, with 80% of loans originating from Poland, raising concerns about limited diversification for investors. Additionally, the platform has not provided updates on its plans for portfolio recovery in Asia, leaving questions about its risk mitigation strategy in that region.
In a related development, TWINO subsidiary Fincard Sp. z.o.o. has obtained a national payment institution license from the Polish Financial Supervision Authority, effective November 22. This license allows Fincard to offer services comparable to banks in payment processing and e-commerce, with the potential for expansion beyond Poland.

entry.id: InRento launches first Buy-to-Let Project in Ireland with 9.5%-10% annual returns - 2024-12-01T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento launches first Buy-to-Let Project in Ireland with 9.5%-10% annual returns
entry.content:
InRento’s Parkview 33 in Renmore, Galway, offers investors 9.5%-10% annual returns. The property, a four-bedroom house, will be converted into two rental units in a high-demand area with minimal supply and average rents of €2,500/month.
Investors receive 8%-8.5% fixed interest, paid monthly, plus 1.5% capital growth, with a maximum 18-month loan term. Strong market fundamentals, including Ireland’s 5.3M population and 3.6% GDP growth forecast for 2025, ensure favorable conditions.

entry.title: LANDE achieves record growth and debt recovery milestones in October 2024
entry.content: LANDE's October 2024 Platform Performance Report highlights notable achievements in agricultural financing. Farmers secured €993,051 in loans across 39 projects, with an average project size of €25,462. Please note that any investments made before 7 October will remain exempt from the fee, as will investments made through Manual Investment and Custom Automation strategies.

entry.id: Hoovi reports a net profit of €180,136 for 2023 - 2024-09-23T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Hoovi reports a net profit of €180,136 for 2023
entry.content:
Hoovi has released its H1-2024 financial results, showing strong growth. Total operating income rose by 65% to €1.1 million, while net profit increased by 156% to €180,000 compared to H1-2023.
Since joining the Income platform in 2022, Hoovi has attracted €8 million in investments, with investors earning €377,000 so far. Offering up to 14% annual returns on business loans, Hoovi remains a strong option for investors seeking higher interest rates.

entry.id: VIAINVEST's lenders are giving away €50,000 in cashback bonuses - 2024-09-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: VIAINVEST's lenders are giving away €50,000 in cashback bonuses
entry.content:
Between September 23 and October 13, 2024, VIAINVEST offers individual investors a chance to receive cashback of up to €700 for new capital investments. Cashback will be credited on November 15, 2024, based on the amount invested during the promotional period.
Investments of €5,000 to €9,999 qualify for a €150 bonus, while those between €10,000 to €19,999 earn €350. Investments exceeding €20,000 will receive a €700 bonus. The total bonus pool is €50,000, distributed on a first-come, first-served basis.

entry.id: Stikcredit H1 2024 results: Strong growth and new car loans - 2024-09-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Stikcredit H1 2024 results: Strong growth and new car loans
entry.content:
Stikcredit has published its results for the first half of 2024, showing significant growth. Net profit increased by over 10% compared to H1 2023, with the loan portfolio growing by 24% since the start of the year. Company assets also rose from €21.8M to €24.4M.
Additionally, the newly introduced auto loans project, still in its pilot phase, is showing promising potential for future expansion.

As of July 31, 2024, the platform had €36,000 in average monthly recurring revenue, 4,231 investors, and €15.1 million in active investments. In 2024, the company aims to grow its investor base, increase partnerships, and raise additional funds.

entry.id: LANDE reports a loss of €73,129 for 2023 - 2024-09-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE reports a loss of €73,129 for 2023
entry.content: The financial statements for SIA "Lande Platform" from January 1, 2023, to December 31, 2023, show a net turnover of €1,610,293, a significant increase from the previous year's €344,014. The gross profit or loss for the period was €782,805, up from €227,011 in 2022. The largest costs were the cost of sales at €482,890 and administration costs of €345,773. After accounting for other income and expenses, the company reported a net loss of €73,129 for 2023, an increase from the €12,981 loss reported in 2022. According to the auditor, the financial report provides a true and clear picture of the company.

entry.id: Security alert: Investor on TWINO targeted in fraud incident - 2024-09-04T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Security alert: Investor on TWINO targeted in fraud incident
entry.content: A TWINO investor recently fell victim to a fraud scheme in which a scammer gained access to the investor's account. The fraudster changed the email address, sold investments on the secondary market, and then used the stolen identity to open a bank account and clear the investment account. This incident is a reminder that such attacks are not uncommon in the P2P lending industry. We strongly urge all investors to activate two-factor authentication (2FA) and remain vigilant in monitoring their online activities.

entry.id: Important Update on Inactive Account Fees - 2024-06-21T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Important Update on Inactive Account Fees
entry.content: The inactive account fee is applied if the investor has not made any new investments within a 12-month period. €10 is applied once the account has been inactive for 12 months and €50 is applied when the period is respectively 24 months. Prior to any fees being deducted, investors will be informed via email that a fee will be applied, and prior to the fees being deducted, investors will have the ability to withdraw their available balance free of charge to avoid the fee from being deducted. The fee will not be deducted from accounts that have either made a small investment or withdrawn their available funds; nobody’s account will be drawn into minus, and nobody will receive an invoice. Therefore, if investors are keen on being idle and withdrawing their funds, then this fee encourages them to do it free of charge.

entry.id: The issuance of crowdlending offers in EU member states without a respective license is prohibited - 2024-01-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: The issuance of crowdlending offers in EU member states without a respective license is prohibited
entry.content: Crowdfunding service providers who are registered in EU member states and have failed to obtain authorization by 10 November 2023, in accordance with the regulation 2020/1503 recital 77 are service providers are prohibited from raising funds via crowdfunding offers. Investors who believe that a crowdfunding platform doesn't have the required authorization and continues issuing crowdfunding offers can contact the local police.

Many concerned investors are questioning Reinvest24's intentions, given the platform is not replying to emails and is delaying withdrawals for up to 40 days. Since Reinvest24 is not regulated in Estonia, it's questionable whether the company can raise further funds from retail investors. Reinvest24 has not given enough information about the legal action or the portfolio performance in Spain. Any further investments on this platform are connected with extreme risk.

entry.id: Update on the legal recovery in Moldova - 2023-12-08T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Update on the legal recovery in Moldova
entry.content: Attached please find the decision of the Bălți Court in regard to the accelerated restructuring procedure of SRL "Metropolis City". The court has decided in favor of the borrower, meaning all the legal actions are on hold, including the calculation of accrued interest and penalties.

entry.id: Statement from DFI, the parent company of Vivus Mexico - 2023-12-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Statement from DFI, the parent company of Vivus Mexico
entry.content: Due to internal policy changes, DFI, the parent company of Vivus MX, is transferring financial assets from DFI Cyprus to another institution as their compliance department now denies transfers to organizations without a domicile banking license. The migration process is underway and expected to finish in 3-5 days, after which repayment will resume, with DFI expressing regret for any inconvenience caused. Vivus MX is yet to repay €553,143 to investors.

entry.title: Bondster lowers the rating of Right Choice from A- to D
entry.content: Due to a mistake, Right Choice Finance has issued loans with a 10-day buyback guarantee. The loan originator cannot meet the 10-day buyback guarantee due to the deteriorated short-term liquidity of the entire financial group. Bondster has suspended the possibility of issuing new loans for Right Choice Finance and lowered its rating to D (defaulted).

entry.title: PeerBerry repays €46.2M or 92% of war-affected loans

entry.id: ClickCash is "commited" to repay €5,000 per month - 2023-11-16T00:00:00Z
entry.title: ClickCash is "commited" to repay €5,000 per month
entry.content: The problematic lender from Brazil, ClickCash is committed to repaying a fixed amount of €5,000 per month. This commitment aims to ensure a steady and predictable flow of repayments to investors. Currently, the principal amount that remains in recovery is €147,991. Should ClickCash not fulfill the repayment schedule, Income Marketplace will step in and cover the difference from its own pocket with the goal of returning the invested principal.

entry.id: InRento receives the ECSP license - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento receives the ECSP license
entry.content: The Bank of Lithuania has issued InRento a European Crowdfunding (ECSP) license. Accordingly, the new license changes the procedures for calculating credit assessment scores, the suitability of a transaction for an investor, and the pricing and rates of interest. Another key change is the possibility for investors to cancel an investment within four days from the date of the transaction, however, this functionality has already been in place on the InRento platform for some time.

entry.id: Profitus receives the ECSP license - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Profitus receives the ECSP license
entry.content: The Bank of Lithuania grants Profitus the European Crowdfunding Service Provider license.

entry.id: TWINO will continue funding Polish loans via its platform from 2024 - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO will continue funding Polish loans via its platform from 2024
entry.content: The platform announced that the upcoming regulation doesn't impact TWINO as their lender in Poland is issuing loans via credit cards. According to TWINO's interpretation of the law, the prohibition of funding loans via P2P investors applies only for companies with a lending license that issue cash loans.

entry.id: Updates on the merger with KoM - 2023-11-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Updates on the merger with KoM
entry.content: Kapitaal op Maat (KoM) and Max Crowdfund (MCF) have teamed up to strengthen their presence in the European crowdfunding market. KoM, leveraging its European Crowdfunding Service Provider Regulation (ECSPR) license, is expanding its crowdfunding activities across Europe following the acquisition of Capital Circle's platform. Simultaneously, MCF seeks a partnership for continuity without an ECSPR permit but with an AFM exemption. Discussions are underway for a potential merger to enhance European expansion, with both parties actively engaging potential partners. MCF is launching a Series-B equity round to fund growth, inviting existing shareholders and users of MCF, KoM, and Capital Circle. The raised funds will also go towards acquiring additional platforms, creating a unified European marketplace.

entry.id: PeerBerry is offering investments in emerging markets - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry is offering investments in emerging markets
entry.content: PeerBerry has started offering new business loans, which will be used to fund the portfolios in Mexico, South Africa, Nigeria, Tanzania, and Colombia. The loan term begins at 30 days, and the offered interest rate starts at 9%. All loans are backed by the buyback and group guarantee.

entry.id: Vivus is facing bank issues - €500,000 is delayed - 2023-11-10T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Vivus is facing bank issues - €500,000 is delayed
entry.content: The founder of Income has confirmed that the outstanding portfolio of €500,000 from Vivus in Mexico is delayed due to bank transfer issues. The platform is expecting the repayment of the final amount soon.

entry.id: PeerBerry will stop offering loans from Poland - 2023-11-04T00:00:00Z
entry.title: PeerBerry will stop offering loans from Poland
entry.content: The platform announced that it will stop the listing of loans from Poland from January 1, 2024, due to the regulatory change that probits lenders to fund their portfolios via P2P investors. To ensure sufficient loan supply, PeerBerry will offer investments in new lenders via a business loan. As the Polish loans represent 17% of the AUM, it might take up to Q2 2024 to replace the current loan supply.

Vivus won't be listing any new loans until the new structure is in place. The lender informed the Income Marketplace that it will clear all late loans by the 21. July 2023.

entry.id: Lendermarket introduced "pending payments" - 2023-07-19T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Lendermarket introduced "pending payments"
entry.content: When a Loan Originator notifies Lendermarket of a borrower's repayment, a "Pending Payment" status is assigned. At this point, Lendermarket has only received notice of the upcoming transfer. Lendermarket is still waiting for the Loan Originator to complete the transfer to Lendermarket.

entry.content: The legal entity behind Debitum platform, DN Operator changes ownership from Mārtiņš Liberts to Henrijs Jansons, Ingus Salmiņš and Ēriks Reņģītis. The former management of Debitum Network raised over € 6 Million worth of DEB tokens to fund the platform's development. The new leadership distances itself from the DEB token and removes it from the platform, claiming the legal entity behind Debitum platform doesn't have any connection to the Token Generation Event conducted by the previous management.

entry.id: Update on the merger with KoM - 2023-11-11T00:00:00Z

entry.content: Kapitaal op Maat (KoM) and Max Crowdfund (MCF) have teamed up to strengthen their presence in the European crowdfunding market. KoM, leveraging its European Crowdfunding Service Provider Regulation (ECSPR) license, is expanding its crowdfunding activities across Europe following the acquisition of Capital Circle's platform. Simultaneously, MCF seeks a partnership for continuity without an ECSPR permit but with an AFM exemption. Discussions are underway for a potential merger to enhance European expansion, with both parties actively engaging potential partners. MCF is launching a Series-B equity round to fund growth, inviting existing shareholders and users of MCF, KoM, and Capital Circle. The raised funds will also go towards acquiring additional platforms, creating a unified European marketplace.

entry.id: First recovery from the German portfolio is expected in Q2/2024 - 2023-11-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: First recovery from the German portfolio is expected in Q2/2024
entry.content: 5% of the German portfolio is performing well, with borrowers seeking refinancing or project exit. About 50% of defaulted borrowers are cooperating with partner Steinberg for resolution, while 10% undergo asset search or legal actions. The most challenging 35% face a 2-year recovery timeline with ongoing legal efforts. Seven insolvency proceedings are underway, taking at least a year, and forced auctions are avoided due to market conditions.

entry.id: TWINO's lender in Vietnam defaulted with a €1.3M loss - 2024-07-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO's lender in Vietnam defaulted with a €1.3M loss
entry.content: TWINO's high-risk venture in collaboration with the VIA SMS Group in Vietnam is over. The company informed selected investors via email that the lender, Hoang Kim Nhat Company Ltd in Vietnam, is preparing for liquidation. TWINO announced that the currently outstanding debt to investors is at €2.7 M, out of which €600,000 should be returned to investors by the end of August 2024. entry.id: Crowdpear reports another default - 2024-07-27T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Crowdpear reports another default
entry.content:
Crowdpear has terminated its contract with UAB "Sondvitus," which had borrowed money for the development of the "Azalijų 1" project. Due to a dispute between the borrower and its business partner, the court has initiated insolvency proceedings.
While investors receive an additional 5% annual interest for each day of delay, under the Law on Insolvency of Legal Entities of the Republic of Lithuania, interest on investments in the "Azalijų 1" project loans will no longer accumulate from the date of the court's decision regarding UAB "Sondvitus"'s insolvency case, effective from July 25th of this year.
Crowdpear is confident that the project's low Loan-to-Value (LTV) ratio of 53% will enable the company to recover all of the investors' funds.

Since joining the Income platform in February 2022, Hoovi has attracted over EUR 7.2M in investments, generating EUR 330k for investors. entry.id: LANDE reports strong loan performance for August 2024 - 2024-09-24T00:00:00Z
entry.title: LANDE reports strong loan performance for August 2024
entry.content: In August 2024, LANDE saw a total of €639,750 issued across 45 projects, with 88% of the loans backed by collateral. The average loan-to-value ratio (LTV) across Latvia, Lithuania, and Romania was 49%. Repayments in August reached €681,597, while total repaid principal stands at €8.72 million. Loan repayment delays were primarily due to seasonal factors in agriculture, particularly affecting Latvian farmers. Despite challenges, the overall default rate remains low, and debt recovery processes continue smoothly across key markets.

These loans are backed by a buyback and group guarantee. Acredit is the second Romanian lender from Aventus to join PeerBerry, following Credit7 RO, which has shifted its loan offerings from short-term to 90-day business loans with a similar 9% interest rate. Investors are encouraged to adjust their Auto Invest settings accordingly.

entry.id: Indemo delivers up to 33% ROI with €211,024 in repayments on A27 Townhouse on Penote - 2024-11-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo delivers up to 33% ROI with €211,024 in repayments on A27 Townhouse on Penote
entry.content: Indemo has completed total repayments of €211,024, impacting around 41% of investor portfolios that included Notes tied to the discounted debt in the A27 Townhouse on Penote. The achieved ROI ranged from 15% to 33% per annum, depending on the investment entry date. Initially listed on Indemo in November 2023, the debt began at the "Auction Initiated" Flow stage with a Price to Value of 65%. Over time, it progressed through various Recovery Flow stages, ultimately reaching the "Access to Estate" stage. The debt was later sold on the secondary market to a debt buyer specializing in post-auction assets.

entry.id: Reinvest24 faces investor backlash amid legal challenges, project delays, and communication silence - 2024-11-20T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Reinvest24 faces investor backlash amid legal challenges, project delays, and communication silence
entry.content: Reinvest24, under CEO Tanel Orro, has recently addressed legal developments in Moldova and Spain, indicating efforts to secure external financing to complete certain development projects. Additionally, some rental properties have been listed for sale. While a detailed recovery plan has not been disclosed, the company anticipates exiting multiple properties and repaying investors by 2025. Communication with affected investors has reportedly been conducted via email; however, public updates have been absent since July. This lack of transparency, coupled with unprocessed withdrawal requests and unanswered investor inquiries, has led to skepticism within the investor community regarding the authenticity of the provided information.

entry.id: Danarupiah adjusts interest rates - 2024-12-13T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Danarupiah adjusts interest rates
entry.content: From December 16th, new Danarupiah loans will offer a 13% annual interest rate, while existing loans remain unchanged. This update aligns with OJK regulations in Indonesia, ensuring competitive returns. Investors should update their Auto Invest settings to include the new rate.

entry.id: Indemo expands loan offerings and ends Fast Track program - 2024-12-13T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo expands loan offerings and ends Fast Track program
entry.content: Indemo has announced an increase in loan availability, enhancing investor opportunities. The platform will also discontinue its fast-track program in its current form by the end of December 2024.

entry.id: December 2024 Performance Update Is Now Available! - 2024-12-15T00:00:00Z
entry.title: December 2024 Performance Update Is Now Available!
entry.content: We've released a new video showcasing the top-performing P2P lending platforms for December 2024. This video includes the latest news and insights that could affect your investments on these platforms.

entry.id: Fintown unveils construction schedule for Honest Michle development - 2024-12-19T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown unveils construction schedule for Honest Michle development
entry.content: Fintown has officially released the construction timeline for Honest Michle, an exciting property development funded by Fintown investors. The construction is projected to conclude by June 2026, with the grand opening anticipated in the latter half of 2026. This milestone underscores Fintown's commitment to transparency and progress in delivering value-driven investment opportunities.

entry.id: Inrento's Grand Sale investment in Vilnius - 2025-01-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Inrento's Grand Sale investment in Vilnius
entry.content: Earn annual returns of 11.5%–12% with fixed interest of 10%–10.5% plus 1.5% capital gains. This Vilnius Old Town project transforms a historic property into a 31-room boutique hotel, projecting €270,000 rental income in 2025. Backed by a 70% LTV ratio and expert management, interest payments begin in February.

entry.id: Interviewing Fintown CEO Maxim Vihorev: Your questions wanted - 2025-01-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Interviewing Fintown CEO Maxim Vihorev: Your questions wanted
entry.content: This week, we’ll speak with Maxim Vihorev, CEO of Fintown, about the company’s 2025 plans. What innovations, strategies, or goals would you like to know about? Share your specific questions in our community thread on our YouTube channel.

entry.id: Lendermarket gains EU crowdfunding authorisation - 2025-01-07T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Lendermarket gains EU crowdfunding authorisation
entry.content: Lendermarket has secured authorisation from the Central Bank of Ireland to operate as a Crowdfunding Service Provider under EU Regulation 2020/1503.

entry.id: Fintown raises €498K for The Seed: Lot 1 in just 9 days - 2025-01-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown raises €498K for The Seed: Lot 1 in just 9 days
entry.content: Fintown celebrates raising €498,000 for The Seed: Lot 1 in just nine days. This 24-month investment offers a 15% annual yield, with a total stage target of €1.5M across three lots. Lot 2/3 is now live, presenting an exclusive opportunity for investors to join.

entry.id: InRento launches Stage II of 46 lofts, Kaunas investment - 2025-01-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: InRento launches Stage II of 46 lofts, Kaunas investment
entry.content: InRento presents a buy-to-let opportunity in Kaunas: 46 Lofts, Kaunas II. Located near Kaunas Žalgiris Arena, this 1,449 m² project features 46 modern loft-style apartments, blending sales and rental options. Investors can expect annual returns of 11.5%–12% (including 10%–10.5% interest and 1.5% capital gains). With rental income projected at €9,000–€24,000 monthly and a 70% LTV cap, the property offers steady cash flow and market potential.

entry.id: Authorities detain administrators in Kirsan debt cases; Reinvest24 silent on withdrawals - 2025-01-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Authorities detain administrators in Kirsan debt cases; Reinvest24 silent on withdrawals
entry.content: Moldovan authorities detained three administrators tied to Kirsan companies’ alleged fraudulent bankruptcies and asset seizures. This follows investigations by the National Anticorruption Agency. While Reinvest24 urges investors to fund legal costs for these cases, it remains silent on processing withdrawal requests.

entry.id: YouHodler introduces $YHDL tokens - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: YouHodler introduces $YHDL tokens
entry.content: YouHodler has launched $YHDL tokens as a reward for achieving high Loyalty Levels. Users can now earn up to 40% annual yield on $YHDL via the Yield account. Once listed publicly, $YHDL holders can access high payouts, trading opportunities, and exclusive features tailored for loyal users.

entry.id: Kirsan Group Scandal: €9 Million Debt and ReInvest24 Missteps - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Kirsan Group Scandal: €9 Million Debt and ReInvest24 Missteps
entry.content: The Kirsan group faces allegations of embezzlement, insolvency fraud, and €9 million in unpaid debts. Estonian platform ReInvest24 is criticized for failing to perform proper due diligence and securing legal protection for funds, contributing to the losses. Additionally, ReInvest24 has reportedly stopped processing investor withdrawals, raising concerns about its operational stability. With key insolvency administrators detained in Bălți, the case exposes systemic corruption and risks European investor trust.

entry.id: TWINO's lender in Vietnam is insolvent, the recovery of €1.3 million is unlikely - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: TWINO's lender in Vietnam is insolvent, the recovery of €1.3 million is unlikely
entry.content: TWINO has confirmed that VAMO Vietnam (Hoang Kim Nhat Company Ltd.) is insolvent, with €1.3 million in outstanding liabilities deemed unlikely to be recovered. Settlement negotiations have failed, and the company has stated its inability to repay investors. TWINO is now pursuing legal measures, although the chances of successful recovery remain low.

entry.id: Indemo completes first discounted debt repayment of 2025 - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo completes first discounted debt repayment of 2025
entry.content: Indemo has repaid €271,485 (principal and interest) to investors in Debt A83—Apartment in Virgen del Cortijo, Madrid, impacting 471 investors and 39% of active Notes. Investor returns ranged from 15.1% to 40.2% p.a., with an average of 21.52%. This milestone marks the platform’s first discounted debt repayment of 2025, showcasing strong performance for both Indemo and its investor community.

entry.id: Monthly fee for loan portfolios begins February 7 - 2025-01-28T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Monthly fee for loan portfolios begins February 7
entry.content: Starting February 7, 2025, a monthly fee of 0.39% p.a. will be charged on outstanding amounts in Core Loans, High-Yield, and Conservative portfolios. This fee applies across these investment options to support streamlined portfolio management.

entry.id: CashX joins PeerBerry with 9% returns - 2025-01-27T00:00:00Z
entry.title: CashX joins PeerBerry with 9% returns
entry.content: Starting January 27, 2025, Nigerian lender CashX NG is offering 30-day business loans on PeerBerry. Backed by buyback and group guarantees, these loans yield a 9% annual return. CashX, known for its quick mobile loan services, began operations in March 2024. Loans will be available periodically based on demand and can be added to Auto Invest for eligible strategies.

entry.id: Mintos’ AirBaltic bond offer sells out in 24 hours - 2025-01-30T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Mintos’ AirBaltic bond offer sells out in 24 hours
entry.content: Mintos’ investment offer in AirBaltic bonds, featuring an 11.3% yield-to-maturity, quarterly payouts, and a five-year term, was fully subscribed within 24 hours. The strong demand highlights investor confidence in the airline and the appeal of high-yield fixed-income opportunities.

entry.id: Fintown opens investment for businesses - 2025-01-30T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Fintown opens investment for businesses
entry.content: Fintown now allows investments through legal entities, enabling entrepreneurs to invest via their companies. The streamlined registration and verification process takes just 24 hours. Investors can easily switch between personal and business accounts, offering greater flexibility and control over their portfolios.

entry.id: Money for Finance reports strong 2024 growth and expansion - 2025-01-30T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Money for Finance reports strong 2024 growth and expansion
entry.content: Money for Finance achieved record business growth in 2024, expanding to 54 branches across Jordan. Their new loyalty program boosted client retention, while advanced analytics enhanced operational efficiency. Debt recovery processes improved significantly, and they received top industry awards. The company is progressing toward Central Bank of Jordan licensing. Effective Feb. 3, 2025, EUR loans will offer a 10% APY and USD loans 11% APY.

entry.id: Nectaro launches exclusive cashback campaign - 2025-02-02T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Nectaro launches exclusive cashback campaign
entry.content: Nectaro introduces a new Cashback campaign, rewarding investors for portfolio growth in February 2025. By increasing investments from February 1 to February 28, participants can earn up to 4% Cashback. Investors with portfolios over €20,000 unlock higher bonus rates. Cashback tiers range from 1.5% to 4%, depending on portfolio growth.

entry.id: Robocash lowers interest rates from February 10 - 2025-02-06T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Robocash lowers interest rates from February 10
entry.content: Starting February 10, interest rates for some loan terms will range between 8% and 10.5%, with a maximum 11.3% for Loyalty program participants. This adjustment addresses growing demand exceeding supply. Existing loans remain unchanged.

entry.id: Indemo launches a limited 1.4% instant cashback bonus - 2025-02-11T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo launches a limited 1.4% instant cashback bonus
entry.content: The platform announced an instant cashback bonus of 1.4% on all investments until the 24. February 2025.

entry.id: Indemo's second debt repayment of 2025 - Up to 36% ROI - 2025-02-18T00:00:00Z
entry.title: Indemo's second debt repayment of 2025 - Up to 36% ROI
entry.content: Indemo has announced its second Discounted Debt repayment of 2025, distributing €190,866 in principal and interest. This marks the platform’s 7th consecutive repayment, benefiting 472 investors and covering 25% of active Notes. Investors saw returns ranging from 16.63% to 36% per annum, with an average weighted ROI of 21.92%.
